p: Considering the analyses of the essential oils of E. globulus and E. nitens obtained, it can be observed that both essential oils are mainly composed of 1,8-cineole and α-pinene, being higher the concentration of 1,8-cineole in the samples corresponding to E. nitens. In the work carried out by Dagne et al. [ 43], 1,8-cineole and α-pinene are also the main components in the essential oils of both species, although with similar values of 1,8-cineole.
